pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:0.5: 35. The training rule on making a heap
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six ate their almsfood picking from a heap. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.3.1: “‘I will not eat almsfood picking from a heap,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.4: Almsfood should not be eaten picking from a heap.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood picking from a heap, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.11: if only a little food remains and he eats it after collecting it in one place and then picking from it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk35:1.15: The fifth training rule is finished.
